opensource.title: Open Source Countdown
opensource.subtitle: Kaitu is going open-source
opensource.description: We are committed to open-sourcing Kaitu's core code, allowing everyone to view, verify and contribute to the code, building a safer and more transparent network tool together.
opensource.releasedDesc: Kaitu's core code is now open-source on GitHub. Visit our repository to view code, submit issues or contribute code.
opensource.reason1Desc: Open-source code allows everyone to review our implementation, ensuring there are no backdoors or malicious code, building genuine trust.
opensource.reason2Desc: Open-source enables developers worldwide to participate, submit improvements and fixes, making the product better.
opensource.reason3Desc: More eyes mean faster discovery and fixing of security vulnerabilities. Open-source software is often more secure than closed-source.
opensource.reason4Desc: We believe technology should benefit everyone. Open-source allows everyone to learn and use advanced network technology.
